questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 tenant that contains a user named User1.
You need to identify the type and number of holds placed on the mailbox of User1.
What should you do first?

discussion.content: was on Exam August 9, 2023
Get-Mailbox cmdlet can be used to find out retention policies for a specific mailbox and also find out holds placed in the mailbox.

Selected Answer: B
Correct, B.
Correct

choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 compliance center, create an eDiscovery case.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 compliance center, run a content search.
choices.D: From Exchange Online PowerShell, run the Get-HoldCompliancePolicy cmdlet.
choices.B: From Exchange Online PowerShell, run the Get-Mailbox cmdlet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/classifier-learn-about?view=o365-worldwide

Where you can use classifiers
Classifiers are available to use as a condition for:

Office auto-labeling with sensitivity labels
Auto-apply retention label policy based on a condition
Communication compliance
Sensitivity labels can use classifiers as conditions, see Apply a sensitivity label to content automatically.
Data loss prevention

comments.content:
D is correct. 
Even if trainable classifiers are not available for all sources in DLP.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Trainable classifiers cannot be applied to sensitivity labels. Sensitivity labels are designed for classifying and protecting content, but they do not utilize trainable classifiers for automatic classification.
Conclusion: Label1 cannot use Trainable1.

Based on the given answers I think nothing is correct
For me it's only: 
- Label1 = Sensitivity Lable with auto-labeling settings on files with the option "Content Contains" -->Trainable Classifiers
- DLP1 = DLP policy --> you can choose also "Content Contains" --> Trainable Classifiers

Policy1 will not work because it's not a "Auto Labeling Policy for Retention" it's only called Retention policy

Selected Answer: C
It's C:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/trainable-classifiers-get-started-with?view=o365-worldwide#:~:text=Once%20trained%2C%20you%20can%20use%20it%20to%20identify%20item%20for%20application%20of%20Office%20sensitivity%20labels%2C%20Communications%20compliance%20policies%2C%20and%20retention%20label%20policies.

comments.content:
I believe the correct answer is: Label1, Policy1 and DLP1, which is not present in the options.
Label1 = Yes, You can use trainable Classifier when creating a Sensitivity Label if you enable the auto-labeling option in the label.
Label2 = No, You CANNOT use Trainable Classifier when creating a retention Label.
Policy 1 = You can use trainable classifier ONLY if this is an auto-labelling policy.
DLP1 = Yes, you can use trainable classifier in DLP policies.

discussion.content: Got this question on exam on 17th August
was on Exam August 9, 2023

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/classifier-learn-about?view=o365-worldwide

Where you can use classifiers
Classifiers are available to use as a condition for:

Office auto-labeling with sensitivity labels
Auto-apply retention label policy based on a condition
Communication compliance
Sensitivity labels can use classifiers as conditions, see Apply a sensitivity label to content automatically.
Data loss prevention

Selected Answer: C
C is right, but DLP can also use Trainable classifiers when Location is restricted to Exchange email, Sharepoint sites, OneDrive Accounts.

comments.content: No it can't because I just tried to create one and a trainable classifier isnt in the list when I create a rule and select, Condition, Content Contains -> Sensitive Information Type.

discussion.content: Trainable classsifers can only bve used when creating sensitivty labels and Retention label policies

Selected Answer: C
Agreed. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/classifier-get-started-with?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a trainable classifier named Trainable1.

You plan to create the items shown in the following table.

//IMG//


Which items can use Trainable1?

discussion.content:
Microsoft 365 Groups
Teams Channel Messages
Yammer community messages

just tested it: 
Microsoft 365 Group mailboxes & sites on its own

or 

teams channel messages (not private channels) 
and yammer community messages

comments.content: Also tested it in lab and agree with your answer

discussion.content:
In this scenario - It would only could be applied to:
From Purview:
Choose locations to apply the policy
Based on the scopes you added, this policy can be applied to content in these locations.
>>Microsoft 365 Group mailboxes & sites<<

So Answer should be:
Microsoft 365 Group
Exchange
Sharepoint

Please please please check link..

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/purview-adaptive-scopes#configure-adaptive-scopes
When you choose to use adaptive scopes, you're prompted to select what type of adaptive scope you want. There are three different types of adaptive scopes and each one supports different attributes or properties:
for this scope, it is type group so selections will be

Microsoft 365 Groups - applies to:
- Microsoft 365 Group mailboxes & sites
- Teams channel messages (standard and shared)
- Viva Engage community messages

M365 group mailboxes & sites is an option who is not display here. 

So the only correct answer are teams channel message and yammer community messages.
thank you all!~
So, given the comments, the underlined answers are not correct.
Using Group as a Scope there are only three options: Microsoft 365 Group mailboxes & sites, Teams channel messages and Yammer Community Messages.
Got this question on exam on 17th August

When you are configuring this by yourself in your tenant you will see that in the scope you can only add 
Teams channel Message, 
Yammer community messages, 
M365 group mailboxses & sites

comments.content:
Right, If adaptiv scope is type "group" you have only following options: 
Teams channel Message,
Yammer community messages,
M365 group mailboxses & sites

If adaptive scope type is "User":
Exchange mailboxes
OneDrive accounts
OR (cann't be together)
Teams chats
Teams private channel messages
Yammer user messages

If adaptive scope type is "Site":
SharePoint sites

discussion.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/retention?view=o365-worldwide

Microsoft 365 Groups - applies to:
- Microsoft 365 Group mailboxes & sites
- Teams channel messages (standard and shared)
- Yammer community messages

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You create an adaptive scope named Scope1 as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


You create a retention policy named Policy1 that includes Scope1.

To which three locations can you apply Policy1? To answer, select the appropriate locations in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1. Site1 contains a file named File1.

You have a retention policy named Retention1 that has the following settings:

â€¢ Retention items for a specific period
o Retention period: 5 years
o At the end of the retention period: Delete items automatically

Retention1 is applied to Site1.

You need to ensure that File1 is deleted automatically after seven years. The solution must NOT affect the retention of other files on Site1.

What should you do first?

choices.D: Move File1 to a new folder and list the excluded locations for Retention1.
choices.C: Publish and apply a new retention label.
choices.A: Move File1 to a new folder and configure the access control list (ACL) entries for File1.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Same as 38

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that uses Microsoft Exchange Online.
You need to recover deleted email messages from a user's mailbox.
Which two PowerShell cmdlets should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Since deleted messages in exchange gets placed in Recoverable Item folder this is pretty logical.
Get-RecoverableItems = Find the item you are looking for
Recover-RecoverableItems = Recover the items you wish to restore

Selected Answer: AD
Correct

Correct
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/recipients-in-exchange-online/manage-user-mailboxes/recover-deleted-messages
